slide.teacher_notes: Introduction to UI
Explain its an everyday object. Ask them to give points related to the tv. What is the Purpose? How often do you use?etc
Ask them questions about TV, how much do you use on a daily basis, what do you use it for

li.p: What is the purpose of the TV?
What are the main components of the TV set?
What are the different actions you perform in a TV?
How do you interact to get the actions done?

slide.teacher_notes: Ask the students the questions one by one. Let them come with the answers for each. Prompt to come up with more answers to each.

li.p: A TV is an telecommunication device for viewing and transmitting moving images (video) and sound
Its components are the screen, the remote and internal components like tuner, picture tube, control board
Actions include switching on/off, changing the channel, increasing or decreasing the volume
Interactions are through remote controller or buttons on the TV set

slide.teacher_notes: tn
tn

slide.p: The means by which the user interacts with an object to do/get what they want Eg: TV remote, TV Screen
slide.teacher_notes: Now we understand what an interface is. It is the medium by which the user interacts with the object to get what they want. Almost all objects have an interface. Take through other examples like door � whose interface are the handle, key etc. For a kettle, the interface is the spout, handle, buttons etc. Each object has an interface for the user to use it.

slide.p: This is an old generation phone before smartphones.
slide.teacher_notes: This is an old generation phone before smartphones.

slide.p: Let's try to understand the possible interaction for this phone
slide.teacher_notes: Discuss the actions and interactions in older cell phones. Emphasize calling/messaging functionality and highlight advantages and disadvantages of this phone. Activity to be conducted as an inclass discussion. Trainer to plan for 5 minutes for activity.
What do we do with a mobile phone?

li.p: To make a call, enter the number through the keypad
Alternatively select the number from the contact list
To send a message, enter the message through the keypad or select contact and press send button to send

slide.teacher_notes: How do we make a call? How do we send a message? more valid points to be added.
slide.h1: And for interactions on this phone:

slide.teacher_notes: Hence interface are the parts by which we get those done. Buttons and the Screen help us interact with the mobile phone.

Now we move to an IT device and identify the interfaces ? mouse, keyboard, wires, plugs, screen, the OS. User interface is the part of the machine by which the user-computer hardware interaction happens. The OS is an user interface. As questions like, how do you start? How do you make it play music? How do you increase the volume. Discuss each of action, interaction, interface. Let the students come up with the answer. Prompt each time for answers.
slide.h1: Identify the actions, interactions and interfaces in a computer system

slide.p: These are general answers. Make the students add more.
slide.teacher_notes: These are general answers. Make the students add more. Come up with generally there is a separate software interface for each interaction. Spend 5 to 7 mins on this discussion

slide.p: -Hardware interfaces like keyboard, mouse -User interface like the windows screen
slide.teacher_notes: tn

slide.p: -Hardware interfaces like keyboard, mouse -User interface like the windows screen
slide.teacher_notes: The students should be made to understand that UI in our course is the visual part of the system that is designed to help the user interact.
Lets see the evolution of interfaces

slide.p: Earlier computer systems had black and white screens.
slide.teacher_notes: Earlier computer systems had black and white screens. Ask how many have used these interfaces. How easy was it to browse a directory or to edit a file? � Interaction was tough and time consuming
Better interfaces were developed. More colors were added. Technology improved to cater to these needs.
Better resolutions. Better performance.

slide.p: Explosion of variety of devices. Best time to live in terms of the technology growth.
slide.teacher_notes: Explosion of variety of devices. Best time to live in terms of the technology growth. Everything is supplied in our finger tips.

slide.p: It is the interface which plays and important part in brining in more users.
slide.teacher_notes: tn It is the interface which plays and important part in brining in more users. People never have the time or patience to get things done. A wide variety of applications have developed to make life easier eg: Shopping is made easy, Booking tickets, Communication etc. Let the students add more.
How important is it?
tn

slide.p: let the students discuss. They must point out what is the easiest to use.
slide.teacher_notes: let the students discuss. They must point out what is the easiest to use. Draw the parallel �The coffee cup is the interface and coffee& biscuit is the content�

slide.p: Drive the students to validate their selection.
slide.teacher_notes: tn Drive the students to validate their selection. Expect arguments for option 2 and 3
Drive the students to validate their selection. Expect arguments for option 2 and 3
tn
tn
Another example....Which is the correct design?
Drive the students to validate their selection. Do they notice the flaw? They should understand that positioning of components is important.
Discuss the importance of each point
Ask how many use google and how often you use google.
slide.h1: Why would you use this more often compared to others?

slide.teacher_notes: Are you happy with the way google is? Do you expect any more features to it? Did you know? The founders of google didn�t know much of html. So they kept the design simple. It eventually proved to be a blessing in disguise. Even now, google products have very simple interface but densely packed functionalities. Eg: Gmail.

li.p: Familiar and adherent to universal standards

slide.teacher_notes: Explain each point with an example with some successful products like google, facebook, iphones etc
Check out if students have understood each of them.
